strings: <Cap><leader> discovers a new recipe for the alchemy pot!
<Cap><string_1> <equal> <Cap><string_2> + <Cap><string_3>
<Cap><string_1> <equal> <Cap><string_2> + <Cap><string_3> + <Cap><string_4>
<se_def>*: Woof woof woof!
<se_def>*: Everything's ready for loading, apart from the ship itself! I dunno where on earth it's got to.
<se_def>*: This place was built by the famous Albert family of Alexandria. We all work for them.
<se_def>*: 'Course, the most famous of them is the young lady Jessica. She's like an idol to us sailors!
<se_def>*: Sorry? A man dressed like a jester? No, I haven't had a customer fitting that description.
<se_def>*: I haven't had any customers at all, for that matter. And until the ferry comes back, I doubt I will have.

<se_low>*: You waitin' for the ferry, too? Don't worry.
It may be a bit late, but it'll turn up eventually.
<se_high>*: Hello. Welcome to Port Prospect.
<se_high>*: I'm here selling herbs. They're only ten gold coins each. Can I tempt you to one or two?

<se_high>*: Fair enough...
Hopefully we can do business next time.
<se_high>*: Good, good. Here we are then.
<se_high>*: Oh dear! I'm afraid it looks like you're a bit short. Maybe we can do business some other time.
<se_low>*: My old flame from when I was a young girl lives across the ocean.
<se_low>*: I wonder if he still collects those funny little medals he loved so much...

<se_def>*: The ferry being late isn't anything out of the ordinary.<page>*: The sea's a living thing, after all.
It can't be helped if it gets a bit ratty sometimes.
<se_def>*: The Albert family asked me to come up with a way to predict what the weather will do.
<se_def>*: It has a huge impact on whether the ferry sails or not, you see.
<se_def>*: Not far from Peregrin Quay on the southern continent, there's a famous place of pilgrimage called Maella Abbey.
<se_def>*: That's where I was planning to go, but who knows when the ferry will finally be ready to take me there.
<se_def>*: I was plannin' on goin' to the abbey and changin' me ways, like... Seems it might be Fate that's stopped the ferry runnin', eh!?
<se_def>*: I'm 'earin' the voice o' the Goddess tellin' me not to bother wiv all that and to just continue the ol' life o' crime!
<se_def>*: Oh! Of all the annoyances!
<se_def>*: I was supposed to be going to the southern continent, but now I'm stuck here.
<se_low>Quartermaster: Huh? Wanna go on the ferry, do ya?
<se_low>Quartermaster: I dunno when the next one'll be. The boat that went off to the southern cont'nent ain't come back yet.

<se_low>Quartermaster: Then keep outta here.
This is the ferry dock.
<se_high>*: I'm afraid all ferry ticket sales have been postponed indefinitely. Try again later.

<se_def>*: I heard the news about poor Alistair's death.
I wonder how everyone in Alexandria is coping.
I'm quite concerned, to tell you the truth.
<se_def>*: Hey, have you ever met Miss Jessica from Alexandria? Now that's what I call a real sight for sore eyes!
<se_def>*: She's a bit spirited at times, but she's any sailor's dream, I can tell ya...

<se_high>*: Hi there!
Go ahead, make yourself comfortable!

<se_high>*: If you've come to see me dance this early in the day, you must be straining at the leash!
But you'll just have to wait 'til tonight! ♪
<se_high>*: Good evening. Welcome to Port Prospect.
<se_high>*: I'm here selling herbs, but I'm finding it really hard to shift them what with the ferry being delayed and everything.
<se_high>*: If it doesn't start bringing me some customers soon, I'll go out of business!
<se_def>*: Aaaaooow!

<se_low>*: Ha ha hah! You eaten too much as well?
Get yourself a bit of night air.
It'll soon sort you out!
<se_def>*: Sorry? A man dressed like a jester? No, I haven't had a customer fitting that description.
<se_def>*: I haven't had any customers at all, for that matter. And until the ferry comes back, I doubt I will have.
<se_def>*: Ah-phew... Ah-phew...

<se_def>*: (Mumble mumble) Urgh, I'm stuffed, Mum.
I can't eat no more...

<se_low>*: You waitin' for the ferry, too? Don't worry.
It may be a bit late, but it'll turn up eventually.

<se_def>*: There's nothing wrong with a bit of gossip every now and then. Bar the really bad stuff,
of course. ‘Bar’! Do you get it!?

<se_high>*: Come on, dance with me! Don't be shy now!
Just loosen up and try to look cool!

<se_def>*: Everything's ready to go, apart from the
ship itself! I dunno what's goin' on!
Why can't we set sail!?

<se_def>*: This gentleman here certainly has an
interesting story to tell. I never imagined
that sort of thing happening at sea.
<se_low>*: Some very strange things happened when I was on the ferry on my way over here.
<se_low>*: First of all, one of the sailors on deck spotted a man walking across the sea!
<se_low>*: We were all reeling from the shock of that when a huge monster surfaced and blocked the ship's path!
<se_low>*: We somehow managed to escape and make our way here, but I was absolutely beside myself with fear for a while.
<se_def>*: This place was built by the famous Albert family of Alexandria. We all work for them.

<se_def>*: And, of course, the most famous of them
all is the sailor's dream, Miss Jessica!
She's here in town right now, you know!
<se_def>*: The people who came over on the ferry are saying something about seeing a man walking across the sea. Can that really be true?

<se_low>*: You waitin' to go on the ferry, too?
Don't worry. It may be a bit late,
but it'll get goin' again eventually.
<se_def>*: Sounds like the ferry was delayed because some sea monster got in its way.
<se_def>*: And it's probably still out there too. We can't set sail again with that lurking in wait.
<se_def>*: I came here from Ascantha on the southern continent.
<se_def>*: I waited a long time for that ferry, and I certainly didn't expect the journey to be quite so eventful! What a strange experience!
<se_high>*: Good evening. Welcome to Port Prospect.
<se_high>*: I'm here selling herbs, but I'm finding it really hard to shift them what with the ferry being delayed and everything.
<se_high>*: Hopefully it'll start running like normal again soon.

<se_def>*: When ya look at a ship from above like this,
it makes ya realise how marv'llous they are.
<se_def>*: Makes me realise how lucky I am to be a sailor, an' all.
<se_def>*: The people who came over on the ferry are saying something about seeing a man walking across the sea. Can that really be true?
<se_low>Quartermaster: That sea monster's supposed to be pretty big an' fearsome, y'know. Sure you lot can really beat it?
<se_def>*: Well, it's been a long wait, but it's finally time to set sail. It's been a while since I was last in the south. I'm rather excited!
<se_def>*: Do I go straight on to Maella Abbey for the straight life, or do I go down, down to good ol' Pickham town...!?
<se_def>*: I s'pose this is like a crossroads in me life, really. Decisions, decisions!
<se_low>Quartermaster: Oi, new boy! Get to it, else we won't get off in time! Move it!

<se_low>Quartermaster: ...Er, sorry. Got the wrong person.
Bit over-excited, see, what with the boat
movin' again after all this time.

<se_def>*: Nice one! I saw you show that great big sea
monster who's boss! With you lot on board,
we've got nothin' to worry about!
<se_def>*: Now the ferry can finally run as normal again! Right! Better get to it and make up for lost time!
<se_def>*: Have you heard the news? Apparently, the monster that got in the way of the ferry has been taken care of!

<se_low>*: What!? Really!?
You defeated that enormous sea monster!?

<se_low>*: Then the town's safe again!
What wonderful news!
<se_def>*: It's great that the ferry's up and running again, but I wonder what that strange sea creature was?
<se_def>*: It's a bit of a worry really. I mean, what happens if something like that pops up again?
<se_low>*: Huh!? Customer, are ya? Better stand on the other side of the counter then!
<se_def>*: A lot of trade goes on between here and the southern continent. It's a real problem if the ferry don't run.
<se_def>*: No time to talk, anyway! Let's get movin'!
<se_def>*: I, er... I've never been on a ship before...

<se_def>*: It r-rocks about quite a lot...
Urgh... I feel sick...

<se_def>*: Hm? Are you a passenger?
I'm afraid you're not allowed in here.
<se_def>*: Really!? Good grief! So you're Miss Jessica's <IF_SOLO>friend<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>friends<ENDIF_SOLO>! The <IF_SOLO>one<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>ones<ENDIF_SOLO> who defeated that sea monster!

<se_def>*: I haven't introduced myself yet.
I'm the ferry captain.
Pleased to meet you.
<se_def>*: I'll be delaying departure as promised until you're ready. It's the least I can do to thank you.
<se_def>*: Just go and find Miss Jessica outside when you're okay to set sail. We're ready whenever you are.

<se_low>Quartermaster: Hey! Ain't you the <IF_SOLO>one<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>ones<ENDIF_SOLO> who defeated that monster!? Go on through, then!
No need to stand on ceremony!

<se_high>*: There's no need for you to buy a ticket.
It's the least we can do to repay you.
<se_high>*: Naturally that includes the passage of all your luggage and your horse as well.
<se_def>*: People just keep coming and going, coming and going... The place feels like a port town again at last.
<se_high>*: Good evening. Welcome to Port Prospect.
<se_high>*: I'm here selling herbs. I managed to make more sales than I hoped today.
<se_high>*: Now that the ferry's running again, I can finally stop worrying about how to make a living.
<se_def>*: It's great that the ferry's up and running again, but I wonder what that strange sea creature was?
<se_def>*: It's a bit of a worry really. I mean, what happens if something like that pops up again?
<se_low>*: Yeah! What a great night! Long live the ferry! Long live Port Prospect!

Jessica: Hey! That was quick!
Are you okay to set sail already?
Jessica: What took you so long!? You're ready now, right? If you're ready, let's hurry up and get going!

Jessica: The ferry doesn't run all that often, so you won't be able to come back here for a while.
Are you okay with that?

Jessica: Come on, then! Let's get going!
We have to hurry and catch up with Dhoulmagus!
Jessica: You're not ready? Then hurry up and do whatever it is you have to do! I'll be waiting for you here.
Jessica: You're still not ready!? Hurry up and do what you've got to do, then! I'll be waiting here.
<se_def>*: This place was built by the famous Albert family of Alexandria. We all work for them.
<se_def>*: 'Course, the most famous of them is the young lady, Jessica. She's like an idol to us sailors!

*: There's a path out to the west of here,
but it's blocked by a landslide at the moment.

*: No one ever really goes that way, though,
so it doesn't make that much difference to us.
*: I went to the casino in Pickham once, but I couldn't relax because the place didn't feel all that safe.
*: I was hoping for something a bit more relaxing and enjoyable.
*: I've heard that there are a few people out there who don't have to rely on the ferry because they have their own ships!

*: I'd love to have my own ship one day.
Ah! I can but dream!
*: This place was built by the famous Albert family of Alexandria. We all work for them.
<se_def>*: I came here from Ascantha on the southern continent.
<se_def>*: I waited a long time for that ferry, and I certainly didn't expect the journey to be quite so eventful! What a strange experience!
<se_def>*: This place was built by the famous Albert family of Alexandria. We all work for them.
<se_def>*: And, of course, the most famous of them all is the sailor's dream, Miss Jessica! She's here in town right now, you know!
<se_high>*: I'm so miserable! Water in a well isn't like water in the sea. It's not nice living down here, not nice at all! I don't feel well!
<se_high>*: Why don't I go back to the sea? Well, it's not that simple. That's why I'm so confused!
<se_high>*: It's the boss... He's the greatest boss in the whole ocean, but he's been acting all weird lately.
<se_high>*: He always used to be so nice, but now he's angry all the time. He's scaring the scales off everyone!
<se_high>*: He even chased me away just because I was salivating a bit over his food!
<se_high>*: Salt... I want salt! I want to drink so much salt water that I burst!
<se_high>*: I normally live in the sea, see. But it's the boss. He's gone all strange...
<se_high>*: Really!? Are you sure!? He's back to normal!?

<se_high>*: Wow! That's the best news ever!
Now I can finally go home to the sea again!

<se_high>*: Farewell, nasty well water! ♪
Maybe I'll take one last sip before I go...
<se_high>*: (Sluuuurp...)
<se_high>*: Haaah!
<se_high>*: Once I'm back in the sea, I won't be able to drink this tasteless stuff again. So I'd better drink as much as I can now.
<se_high>*: (Glug glug... Burp!)

<se_def>*: There's a path out to the west of here,
but it's blocked by a landslide at the moment.

<se_def>*: No one ever really goes that way, though,
so it doesn't make that much difference to us.
<se_def>*: I went to the casino in Pickham once, but I couldn't relax because the place didn't feel all that safe.
<se_def>*: I was hoping for something a bit more relaxing and enjoyable.
<se_low>*: I've heard that there are a few people out there who don't have to rely on the ferry because they have their own ships!

<se_low>*: I'd love to have my own ship one day.
Ah! I can but dream!
<se_def>*: This place was built by the famous Albert family of Alexandria. We all work for them.
<se_def>*: The easiest way to get to Alexandria from here is to follow the main path.
<se_def>*: But some people do deviate from it a bit and take short cuts.
<se_low>*: The ferry's been runnin' bang on time ever since that little incident. Business is boomin' thanks to you!

<se_def>*: Ever since that time the ferry couldn't sail,
I've realised how much everyone here relies on it.
I make sure to take good care of it now.
<se_def>*: Well, here we are. I'd better get on with checking over the mast.
<se_def>*: Ships are funny things, you know.<page>*: If you don't keep up repairs on them properly, you can land yourself in deep water, and that's when you need a well-maintained ship the most!
<se_low>Quartermaster: Sometimes I feel like goin' and relaxin' up on top of a hill for a bit, but I know I'd only miss the sea if I did.
<se_low>Quartermaster: Sailors are funny characters, eh!?

<se_high>*: My son asked me to bring him here so he
could look at the ship. It's my first time too,
and I must say that I'm astounded at its size!

<se_high>*: Wow! The ship's so huge!
And the sea's even huger!
This is so cool!
<se_def>*: Well, here we are. I hope your onward journey will be a pleasant one.

<se_def>*: Well ahoy there, Miss Jessica!
We don't often see you here.

<se_def>*: I haven't been to Alexandria for a bit.
Alistair doin' okay, is he?
<se_def>*: Hey, have you ever met Miss Jessica from Alexandria? Now there's a sight for sore eyes!
<se_def>*: She's a bit spirited at times, but she's any sailor's dream, I can tell ya...
<se_def>*: The easiest way to get to Alexandria from here is to follow the main path.
<se_def>*: But some people do deviate from it a bit and take short cuts.
<se_low>*: I work hard all day and drink hard at night... Ya can't beat life in a port town!
<se_def>*: This place was built by the famous Albert family of Alexandria. We all work for them.
<se_def>*: The path over to the west has finally been opened up again.
<se_def>*: Not that anyone ever really goes west, mind.

<se_def>*: This fellow here is so knowledgeable.
Any scholar would have a lot to learn from him.

<se_low>*: ...Hmm.
So you're looking for the Moonshadow harp?

<se_low>*: I've only ever heard rumours of it too,
but it sounds like a truly splendid instrument.
<se_low>*: I imagine a thing like that, with such beautiful sound and shape, has probably been claimed by some kingdom or other as its treasure.
<se_low>*: It's all myth and legend, though, so it's impossible to say exactly where it might be.

<se_def>*: Hm? Moonshadow harp?
Is that the name of a cocktail?
<se_low>*: ...Goodness! Is that the famous Moonshadow harp!? What a spectacular thing!

<se_low>*: Who'd have thought it really does exist!?
Well, you learn something new every day!
<se_def>*: The pub doesn't open until evening.

<se_def>*: Welcome, welcome!
Make yourself comfortable and drink your fill!

<se_def>*: That thing the other day was amazin', eh?
The sky burnin' red like that.
<se_def>*: Never seen anythin' like that before! But the ferry's still runnin' all right. No problems there, unless the sea starts burnin' red too!
<se_def>*: I used to study the weather here, but I'd never once seen the sky turn red like that before.
<se_low>*: Some very strange things seem to be happening in the world lately.
<se_low>*: I'm thinking it might be wise to return to my family while the ferry's still running.

<se_low>*: I don't care if the sky's red, white or blue!
All I care about is how the old business is goin'!
<se_low>*: My old flame lives on a small island in the middle of the sea. He collects medals, you know.
<se_low>*: He was a real good-for-nothing, but he had a certain charm when it came to the ladies.

<se_low>*: I probably haven't got all that long left.
It would've been nice to see him again.
<se_def>*: I saw this weird, enormous island floatin' through the sky, but I haven't told the others about it.
<se_def>*: They'd probably just think I'd been on the bottle all day if I did.
<se_def>*: It's a relief that today's voyage went off without a hitch.
<se_def>*: Ever since the sky went weird, I've been a bit worried about what might happen to the sea.
<se_def>*: I was in here so I didn't see it, but is it really true that the sky turned red? I'd have liked to see that!
<se_high>*: Lots of people are saying weird things about the world coming to an end, but I don't see the point in worrying about it.
<se_high>*: Best just to relax and go with the flow! ♪

<se_low>*: I don't care if the sky's red, white or blue!
All I care about is how the old business is goin'!

<se_low>*: Let's say you're a dab hand with the old sword. You can't use the special skills you learnt with that when you switch to another weapon.<page>*: They just won't work.
Well, not usually, anyway.
<se_low>*: So the trick is to use your noodle when you're deciding what to do with your skill points. Think about the weapons you use and what skills you want to learn.
<se_low>*: You know, some people even hold off allocating their points until they've figured out what kind of fighter they are, and then whack 'em all out in one go!
<se_low>*: Then you can equip the right weapon for the job when you want to use one of your special skills, you see. That's what the pros do.
<se_def>Cameron Obscura: Ah, hello there, <leader>. I hope you're making good use of your travels to take some interesting photographs.

<se_def>Cameron Obscura: My dream is finally realised!
And it's all thanks to you.

<se_def>Cameron Obscura: Well, I certainly hope you won't let that photographic talent of yours go to waste in
the future. You have an eye for it, you know.
<se_def>Cameron Obscura: I should like to see what kind of a photographer you are. Would you be so kind as to take a picture of my good self?
<se_def>Cameron Obscura: To take a photo, you simply press START to look through the lens, and then press the A button to snap what you see. Elementary!

<se_def>Cameron Obscura: Any photographs removed from your album
will still remain on the SD card,
so don't worry about taking too many.
Shoot away with impunity!
<se_def>Cameron Obscura: Speaking of which, why don't you take a few shots of the famously splendid coast at Port Prospect, hm? Holidays are Codex days!
<se_def>Cameron Obscura: Remember that a little holy water keeps the monsters away <endash> well, the weaker ones, at least. That can come in handy when you're trying to line up a shot.

<se_def>Cameron Obscura: Tell me, are you embellishing your photos?
Because some of your shots could turn out to be real masterpieces! Yes, you can add all manner of adornments to them as you peruse your album.

<se_def>Cameron Obscura: Speaking of which, if you use some eau de monster, you can get up close to monsters without them noticing you.
Very useful for ‘wildlife’ photography.

<se_def>Cameron Obscura: Speaking of which, a good view from a hilltop at night can be quite something. Makes for a fantastic photograph if you can capture it.
Yes, all outdoors invites my Codex!

<se_def>Cameron Obscura: ...What's that? Having trouble taking good photographs, you say? Hm, I see.<page>Cameron Obscura: Well, photos capture memories.
So you might find you get the best shots
when you're enjoying yourself.
<se_def>Cameron Obscura: This world really has a never-ending supply of beautiful views and stunning sights to behold. Stumbling upon them is one of the many benefits of travel.
<se_def>Cameron Obscura: Speaking of which, you know that pressing the START button switches you into shooting mode, don't you? That's how you look through the lens.

<se_def>Cameron Obscura: When you look back over the photographs
you've taken during your travels, it will bring
back many fond memories, I'm sure.
I really can't recommend it enough!

<se_def>Cameron Obscura: Any photographs removed from your album
will still remain on the SD card,
so don't worry about taking too many.
Shoot away with impunity!
<se_def>Cameron Obscura: You'll find that when they're behind the lens, people don't move a muscle. Everyone wants to look their best for a photograph, you see.

<se_def>Cameron Obscura: ...Hm? The secret to taking a good photograph? Well now, let's see... I would have to say love.
Love finding things to shoot. Love the lens.
Love photography!
<se_def>Cameron Obscura: Remember that a little holy water keeps the monsters away <endash> well, the weaker ones, at least. That can come in handy when you're trying to line up a shot.
<se_def>Cameron Obscura: I hear there's an unusual ability called ‘monstrous musk’ that actually attracts monsters to you! People have some funny ideas, certainly!
<se_def>Cameron Obscura: A photograph can capture a person's true nature sometimes. That's the real pleasure of the hobby, actually. Just be careful not to take it too far!

<se_def>Cameron Obscura: Speaking of which, if you use some eau de monster, you can get up close to monsters without them noticing you.
Very useful for ‘wildlife’ photography.

<se_def>Cameron Obscura: ...The secret to taking a good photograph?
Hm, well, it's worth remembering that the same place can appear very differently at different times, of course.

<se_def>Cameron Obscura: Fine days like today are made for taking photographs! Yes, the weather is simply divine.
I haven't felt this excited in quite some time,
you know!
<se_def>Cameron Obscura: Speaking of which, you know that pressing the START button switches you into shooting mode, don't you? That's how you look through the lens.

<se_def>Cameron Obscura: Once you've taken a picture of me,
would you be so kind as to let me see it?

<se_def>Cameron Obscura: Ah! Am I right in thinking you have a photograph to show me? Come along then,
let's have a look...
<se_def>Cameron Obscura: Well, thanks to your efforts, I have fulfilled my dream of seeing the world <endash> all without leaving this spot!
<se_def>Cameron Obscura: You've managed to take a photograph of every single thing I wanted you to. Which deserves a reward, I think, don't you? Here...
<Cap><leader> obtains <INDEF_ART_SGL_I_NAME_1>!

<se_def>Cameron Obscura: Well, I certainly hope you won't let that photographic talent of yours go to waste in
the future. You have an eye for it, you know.
<se_def>Cameron Obscura: Oh yes, just as I anticipated, this is quite excellent. A marvellous photograph!
<se_def>Cameron Obscura: Well, I think you deserve a reward for completing your first photographic quest from me so convincingly. Take this...
<Cap><leader> obtains a bottle of eau de monster!

<se_def>Cameron Obscura: Put some of that on, and you'll find monsters don't notice your presence for a while.
You can march right up to them without
having to unsheathe your sword.
<se_def>Cameron Obscura: I'm sure you'll find it invaluable when trying to capture a good photograph of some of our more dangerous ‘wildlife’.
<se_def>Cameron Obscura: I've already added the details of a new quest for you in my Challenge Codex. Be sure to glance over it at some point.
<se_def>Cameron Obscura: Be sure to check my Challenge Codex occasionally, won't you? It's in the Misc. menu.
<se_def>Cameron Obscura: I don't see any snaps of things I've asked for in my Challenge Codex, though. I'll give you a little something if you manage to capture what I'm after, you know.
<se_def>Cameron Obscura: Be sure to check my Challenge Codex occasionally, won't you? It's in the Misc. menu.

<se_def>Cameron Obscura: Ah, splendid! It looks like you've managed
to snap a photograph I was after. Now then,
let's have a good look...

<se_def>Cameron Obscura: If you manage to take a photograph of the
subject of any quests in my Challenge Codex,
I'll give you a little reward, you know.
<se_def>Cameron Obscura: Be sure to check my Challenge Codex occasionally, won't you? It's in the Misc. menu.
<se_def>Cameron Obscura: Do show me if you take any photographs, won't you? So...I look forward to seeing what you come up with!
<se_def>Cameron Obscura: Oh, just a moment. You still haven't taken a picture of me yet, have you?
